trans-unit.source: Provides a format-independent mechanism for transferring data.
The IDataObject interface is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Clipboard> class for data transfer operations like drag-and-drop.
When implemented by a class, the IDataObject methods enable a single data object to offer data in multiple formats.
Offering data in multiple formats tends to make the data usable by a wider variety of applications than if only a single data format were supported.
The <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class provides a basic implementation of the IDataObject interface.
Retrieves a data object in a specified format; the data format is specified by a string.
For an implementation of this method, see <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetData%2A>.
A string that specifies what format to retrieve the data as.
See the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class for a set of predefined data formats.
A data object with the data in the specified format, or **null** if the data is not available in the specified format.
Retrieves a data object in a specified format; the data format is specified by a <xref:System.Type> object.
For an implementation of this method, see <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetData%2A>.
A <xref:System.Type> object that specifies what format to retrieve the data as.
See the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class for a set of predefined data formats.
A data object with the data in the specified format, or **null** if the data is not available in the specified format.
Retrieves a data object in a specified format, optionally converting the data to the specified format.
For an implementation of this method, see <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetData%2A>.
A string that specifies what format to retrieve the data as.
See the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class for a set of predefined data formats.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to attempt to automatically convert the data to the specified format; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> for no data format conversion.

If this parameter is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>, the method returns data in the specified format if available, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the data is not available in the specified format.
A data object with the data in the specified format, or **null** if the data is not available in the specified format.
Checks to see whether the data is available in, or can be converted to, a specified format; the data format is specified by a string.
For an implementation of this method, see <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetDataPresent%2A>.
Call **GetDataPresent** to determine whether a specified format is available in this data object before calling <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A>.
Call <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetFormats%2A> to obtain a list of all the formats that are available in this data object.
A string that specifies what format to check for.
See the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class for a set of pre-defined data formats.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data is in, or can be converted to, the specified format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Checks to see whether the data is available in, or can be converted to, a specified format.
The data format is specified by a <xref:System.Type> object.
For an implementation of this method, <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetDataPresent%2A>.
Call **GetDataPresent** to determine whether a specified format is available in this data object before calling <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A>.
Call <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetFormats%2A> to obtain a list of all the formats that are available in this data object.
A <xref:System.Type> that specifies what format to check for.
See the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class for a set of predefined data formats.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data is in, or can be converted to, the specified format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Checks to see whether the data is available in, or can be converted to, a specified format.
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> flag indicates whether to check if the data can be converted to the specified format, if it is not available in that format.
For an implementation of this method, see <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetDataPresent%2A>.
Call **GetDataPresent** to determine whether a specified format is available in this data object before calling <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A>.
Call <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetFormats%2A> to obtain a list of all the formats that are available in this data object.
This method returns **true** when: - The *autoConvert* parameter is **true** and the data is in the specified format, or it can be converted to the specified format.
- The *autoConvert* parameter is **false** and the data is in the specified format.
This method returns **false** when: - The *autoConvert* parameter is **true** and the data is not available in the specified format and cannot be converted to the specified format.
- The *autoConvert* parameter is **false**, and the data is not available in the specified format.
A string that specifies what format to check for.
See the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class for a set of pre-defined data formats.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to only check for the specified format; <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to also check whether or not data stored in this data object can be converted to the specified format.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data is in, or can be converted to, the specified format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns a list of all formats that the data in this data object is stored in, or can be converted to.
For an implementation of this method, see <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetFormats%2A>.
An array of strings, with each string specifying the name of a format supported by this data object.
Returns a list of all formats that the data in this data object is stored in.
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> flag indicates whether or not to also include formats that the data can be automatically converted to.
For an implementation of this method, see <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetFormats%2A>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to retrieve all formats that data stored in this data object is stored in, or can be converted to; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to retrieve only formats that data stored in this data object is stored in (excluding formats that the data is not stored in, but can be automatically converted to).
An array of strings, with each string specifying the name of a format supported by this data object.
Stores the specified data in this data object, automatically converting the data format from the source object type.
For an implementation of this method, see <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SetData%2A>.
The data to store in this data object.
Stores the specified data in this data object, along with one or more specified data formats.
The data format is specified by a string.
For an implementation of this method, see <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SetData%2A>.
A string that specifies what format to store the data in.
See the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class for a set of pre-defined data formats.
The data to store in this data object.
Stores the specified data in this data object, along with one or more specified data formats.
The data format is specified by a <xref:System.Type> class.
For an implementation of this method, see <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SetData%2A>.
A <xref:System.Type> that specifies what format to store the data in.
See the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class for a set of predefined data formats.
The data to store in this data object.
Stores the specified data in this data object, along with one or more specified data formats.
This overload includes a <xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> flag to indicate whether the data may be converted to another format on retrieval.
For an implementation of this method, see <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SetData%2A>.
A string that specifies what format to store the data in.
See the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class for a set of pre-defined data formats.
The data to store in this data object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to allow the data to be converted to another format on retrieval; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to prohibit the data from being converted to another format on retrieval.
